results.title: Senior C# Developer
results.description:
Are you a Senior .NET Developer? Are you curious about the latest developments in the tech industry and do you want to have influence in bringing these into the team? Then this role could be for you. It is a hands-on coding role, but you will be able to bring your own skills to the role.

 

Keeper Solutions is a market-leading software development partner for innovative FinTech, CleanTech and MedTech firms such as Fexco, Taxamo, Vitalograph, Sweepr, Umba, and AccountsIQ. At Keeper Solutions, we help our clients to scale up their software development capabilities. Our team is made up of the best, most highly-skilled, senior software specialists across all technical competencies. Our culture values people and rewards curiosity and learning. We encourage new ideas and collaborative thinking, even with teams working across different time zones. We enjoy the thrill of working on new and exciting projects for our international customers. 

Keeper Solutions has several delivery centers located across Europe and North America to support our global customer base. This includes centres in Croatia, Serbia, Romania, Poland, and Costa Rica. 

 

To be considered for this superb opportunity, we're looking for:

 

  • At least three years' experience in asp.Net, C#.Net or .Net, HTML4 & 5, CSS 2 & 3,
  • JavaScript, SQL Server with specific reference to T-SQL - 2008 - 2012
  • A degree in a relevant IT discipline such as Computer Science 
  • First-class interpersonal and communication skills both written and verbal. You should also be passionate about delivering high-quality and innovative software solutions, with a confident, problem-solving attitude.
  • Experience of MVC, Web Services, JQuery, AJAX would be beneficial. 
  • Experience of DevExpress components would be equally favorable. 
  • Some knowledge of automated testing tools and frameworks would be advantageous to your application.
  • Knowledge of SQL Reporting Services 2008 R2, as well as good technical documentation writing skills
  • Must be able to demonstrate coding skills by passing a coding assessment test online 

 

Requirements:

  • A bachelor's degree in computer programming, computer science, or information technology.
  • C#, .NET 3.5 (or higher).
  • A minimum of 3 years of experience as a C# developer.
  • Ability to write clean, easy-to-understand code.
  • Outstanding analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and complete projects with minimal supervision.
  • Sound understanding of coding and development processes.
  • Experience with working in an agile environment.

 

Benefits of Working With Keeper Solutions

  • Competitive salary that rewards performance, drives innovation includes performance pay.
  • Annual health check – to make sure you're fit and healthy and help you stay that way.
  • On-site training in Ireland + the opportunity for up to 1 week on-site with client per annum (fully expensed)
  • Learning & Development – identify areas for development and we'll provide time and access to training materials.
  • Internal R&D projects are available to help develop leading edge skills in areas such as AI, Big Data and Blockchain.
  • Flexibility to engage with us as an Employee or Independent Contractor – we seek a minimum commitment of at least one year for each person joining our team – hopefully you'll be happy to stay much longer!

results.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
results.description:
If you haven't heard of us

Staking Rewards is on a mission. Agency is the strategy, passive income from Crypto is one of our tactics in this strategy. We're building tools, platforms and products to help you, ourselves and others to achieve an impactful level of control over their income and help to improve the quality of their investment decisions.

We serve different kinds of stakeholders, investors, analysts and crypto community members worldwide. The narrative we're always pushing is Agency. We want you to be in control. ​​This is why we're on a mission to increase transparency, reduce entry barriers and enable everyone to become financially independent. We make staking easy & accessible.

Let's cut to the chase, Staking Rewards is a close-knit team, 20 some members all working remotely, all over the world. Working here means you pick your own timezone, you pick your own vacation days, have as many of them as you see fit, get compensated well, feel comfortable saying “No” and engage in intelligent dialogues with curious people. The only thing we ask in return is to bring your A-game. Get the job done, with a positive intent and a positive attitude. 

The person we're looking to work with

An Engineer that values quality over quantity. Has a deep understanding of software design and how to apply design principles on different types of problems. Some call them well-rounded Engineers or 10x Engineers, we simply call them good Engineers. 

Good Engineers can learn and adapt. They are creative and curious at all times. 

This is what we're looking for.

You will work with familiar technologies, but you will also be expected to work with unfamiliar technologies, you will learn on the job, you will challenge yourself and the status quo. Most importantly, you will be proud of your work. 

Nevertheless, we expect you have gained a good chuck of experience with different environments in your senior career so far and optimally worked in a React environment last so you can bring your A-game from day one.

Engineering at Staking Rewards

In two words, it's comfortable chaos. Our systems are constantly changing, evolving and adapting as the business alongside the crypto market does. Engineering in our environment means constantly facing challenges and being resourceful in our solutions. 

We work the problem. An Engineer at Staking Rewards is expected to inquire, communicate expectations and be open to unusual solutions. Our strength comes from our ability to deliver strong, high quality solutions in an ever changing business environment. 

We keep our feedback loops short and always aim to find the best possible solution together as one Engineering team.

Where do you fit in there?

You become one of the heroes in this saga. An Engineer capable of working on different challenges and storylines.

Some of these challenges we'd like you to focus on are

  • Building high performing web experiences
  • Bringing a strong defensive security mindset to our code and technical practices
  • Building for others: other developers on the team, for stakeholders and our users
  • Own the full vertical: shape, build, ship, monitor

Sounds good, what now?
  1. You send us your application
  2. Screening Interview with one of our team members (30 min)
  3. Take home coding challenge (max. 5 days)
  4. Interview Day
    1. Challenge Recap & Top grading interview with the CTO / Head of Engineering (60-90 min)
    2. Focused peer interviews (3 x 30 min)
  5. You give us three contacts as a reference that we will reach out to
  6. You will receive our offer
  7. Congratulations, you're part of the Staking Rewards team!

results.title: Senior Frontend Engineer - Creator Tools

results.title: Senior Back-end Engineer
results.description:
Odin is setting the new standard of excellence on construction sites around the world. Our innovative SaaS platform ensures compliance, improves safety, and delivers operational efficiency by leveraging the valuable data generated on the jobsite. With Odin’s cloud-based onboarding process, new workers can be verified, badged, and ready to work in under 30 minutes, allowing safety managers to focus on safety instead of paperwork and compliance.

Our platform also provides real-time manpower visibility, making it clear who’s on site, how long they’ve been there, and whether they’re in compliance. Odin has already tracked over 4,500,000 labor hours across our portfolio of jobsites, which includes Related’s Hudson Yards, the largest privately financed construction project in the world.

This Role

As a Senior Backend Engineer at Odin, you will help to expand the functionality of industry-leading web and mobile applications that our clients use on some of the largest construction projects in the country. You’ll work closely with a lean, experienced engineering team as well as product managers, designers and business stakeholders to put scalable, efficient front-end applications into our clients hands and optimize their impact.

Your work will include:

  • Building out objects and operations in our GraphQL API to enable our web and mobile applications to perform sophisticated business actions with an easy-to-use interface.
  • Implementing new workflows and features that add important functionality to our platform and using quantitative and qualitative feedback from telemetry and clients to improve it over time.
  • Participating in sprint ceremonies including daily stand-ups, planning, retrospectives, and architecture discussions.
  • Reviewing code and having your code reviewed. We value a culture of feedback and continuous improvement.
  • Maintaining and improving our CI/CD and testing frameworks to enable faster and more confident deployments.
  • Collaborating with fellow engineers, product managers and stakeholders on the best approaches to grow our impact as a company.

Requirements

  • You have experience building and maintaining APIs, including design patterns shared across a team.
  • You’re adept with or are interested in building expertise with the following stack:
    • Typescript / Node.js
    • GraphQL / Apollo
    • Containerized development in Docker & Kubernetes
    • Google Cloud Platform
  • You’re a strong collaborator who wants to both learn from and contribute to a growing engineering organization.
  • You understand the important decisions that balance moving quickly with stability and maintainability.

Benefits

  • Work on big problems with big impact. You’ll have the opportunity to build brand new solutions solving important problems for a multi-trillion-dollar market. As an early hire in a fast-growing company, you get to help shape both the product and the team.
  • Great compensation. Including competitive salary and meaningful equity in an early-stage company. We also offer a comprehensive benefits package with medical, vision, dental, FSA and life insurance, parental leave, unlimited PTO policy and 401k matching.
  • The best tools to be effective. Company provided MacBook and home office subsidy
  • A fully-remote culture. We have no physical headquarters and plan to stay that way. We’re investing in creating our virtual culture, and providing the option to travel occasionally and meet your colleagues at sponsored off-sites.


Commitment to Diversity

Odin is committed to hiring the best team possible to build a labor management platform that works for real estate developers and construction workers alike. We have a diverse set of problems to solve, and believe that we need a diverse set of perspectives to provide the best possible solutions to those problems. We look for talent from different backgrounds - including but not limited to - race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, disability, and veteran status.

results.title: .Net Engineer

If you love to code, can easily prioritize and analyze work, and keep one eye on the bigger picture and business needs - then you're the Senior Back End Engineer we're looking for.

We expect that you will use your full knowledge and skills to design, build, and maintain reliable lines of code, but also help develop the strategic plan for projects, train and assist junior colleagues and leave your mark to one of our most complex and enterprise projects.

At IT Labs, learning is a process that never stops and we much appreciate a positive attitude towards learning new things, proactivity and innovative approach when facing challenges, and above all - the will to cooperate with every team member.

Sound like a job for you?

Requirements

  • Proficient in C#, with a good knowledge of its ecosystems
  • Ability to understand and use Object-Relational Mapper (ORM) frameworks
  • Ability to understand, recognize and properly implement software design principles and patterns
  • Ability to diagnose, prevent and mitigate any security vulnerabilities
  • Ability to conceptualize and create abstract models that organize elements with data modeling
  • Experience and knowledge of frontend technologies (JS frameworks)
  • To know how to query, manipulate and manage data storage
  • Ability to build and maintain Web API services
  • To be experienced with using cloud services (AWS)

We’ll also appreciate if you have:

  • A positive attitude, with the willingness to learn and collaborate
  • Analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
  • Strong desire to stay on top of the latest developments in web technologies

Benefits

We are a collaborative, supportive, and diverse bunch of people, who enjoy working together and treat each other with the utmost respect. Here everyone has the opportunity to share their experience, learn, and grow. Here are some of the perks we offer:

  • Unlimited working from home
  • PTO
  • Referral Bonuses
  • Working on international projects,
  • Salary in Dollars
  • Professional Development Program
  • Chose your job type; Contract or B2B


Our values

We are a company that seeks the best for both our employees and clients, reaching beyond expectations in turning dreams into reality. Our way of working is rooted in our core values (Integrity, Excellence, Proactivity, Innovation, and People), with an expectation that our future colleagues will make these their second nature in their everyday work and life. We don’t ask for perfection, but we do appreciate people motivated to better themselves in every conceivable aspect.

 

About IT Labs

Founded in 2005, IT Labs is an international software tech company, specializing in purpose and process-driven teams for high-performance, innovation, transformation, and efficiency. Our HQ is in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, and we have teams and offices around the world - the UK, the Netherlands, Belarus, Serbia, and North Macedonia. We are constantly growing, and we would love for you to become part of our team!

results.title: COE Engineering Lead
results.description:
Be Part of Something Big

Foxbox Digital is an award-winning digital product agency based in Chicago. We partner with clients ranging from Fortune 50 companies to high-growth startups and everything in between to design, develop and deliver successful digital products. We share a love of technology and challenge limits: we love what we do and each foxboxer brings their creativity to build and launch successful digital products.

We believe that in order to make an impact, we must do it purposely.

The person who fills this role is expected to have a large impact on the success of Delivery and their respective COE. Leaders in this role are capable of identifying priorities across all projects and keeping their team focused on creating high-value, including identifying appropriate project staffing and headcount. As part of keeping the team focused, the COE Engineering Lead will partner closely with the product lead to manage project scope and ensure the technical deliverables are met. In addition to focusing on the team, the COE Engineering Lead will support Sales by developing a set of materials to help position and package offers to potential clients and provide achievable estimates to sell the engineering work.

The COE Engineering Lead will spend less time writing code, though they still engage in technical deliverables and acting as technical lead on your chargeable projects, without blocking or slowing down the progress of their team. More than writing code, you hold the responsibility for identifying and clearing bottlenecks and roadblocks to success for your team. As an independent manager, you are comfortable managing team members with common and different skills sets. You can communicate expectations clearly using flexible leadership styles set clear direction and motivation for your team members.

You’ll be a valued core member of our team and help build cutting-edge applications for our clients.

  • Manages a center of excellence, identifing growth opportunities within COE to evaluate and develop for all team members.
  • Responsible for technical health and performance on all projects, accurate time-keeping, and achievement of team and individual changeability targets.
  • Explains and communicates challenges to Delivery leadership and works to build consensus at departmental levels.
  • Partners with management to define goals and determines how to use or hire resources to meet goals.
  • Has developed depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline to guide and participate in client-related projects.
  • Utilizes fully developed business knowledge and collaboration outside of department to drive departmental problems to solution.
  • Is available, approachable and accessible and is known to be willing and able to help when the need arises including small bug fixes and building out small features.
  • Supports Sales by establishing materials for selling services of the respective COE
  • Supports Sales by providing achievable estimates for new and renewing client proposals

Requirements

  • Prior experience supervising people directly or indirectly on engineering teams is desirable.
  • Must be comfortable guiding others in project work and through business decisions.
  • Desire to continue to pursue technical discipline: Mobile / Web / Back-end / DevOPs / Architecture / QA
  • Prioritizes and takes action on the needs of both internal and external clients to designs and deliver products and services with the client experience top of mind.
  • Capable of working well with others both on the team and cross-functionally to achieve individual goals, team goals, department goals, and/or organizational goals, valuing diverse perspectives and working with others as a way to achieve the best output possible.
  • Uses critical thinking to evaluate problems, gather information, understand causes, and identify best possible solutions, investing time in planning, discovery, and reflection to drive better decisions and more efficient implementations.
  • Effectively and appropriately interacts with others to build relationships, influence others, and facilitate the sharing of ideas and information. Uses tact and diplomacy to navigate difficult situations.
  • Thrives and grows in a rapidly changing and complex environment, displaying flexibility, activates networks of colleagues, and adopts a continuous growth mindset to learn from mistakes and bounce back from adversity.

Benefits

Technologies we use:
  • Backend: Node.js / Python / NodeJS / Go / Ruby / Java / .Net / Elixir / React Native
  • Frontend: Javascript / React.js / Vue.js / React Native
  • Mobile: Android / iOS

Why Foxbox Digital:
  • We offer continuous training and growth opportunities
  • You are part of a multicultural and collaborative team that is constantly growing.
  • Don’t be afraid to break things; we encourage risk-takers.

Diversity and Inclusion

Foxbox Digital is an LGBT company certified by the Illinois and National LGBT Chambers of Commerce. We are committed to working with diverse and inclusive teams to continue building the digital revolution.

Foxbox is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all and team members with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Foxbox are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Foxbox will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Foxbox encourages applicants of all ages.

results.title: Staff Software Engineer, Full Stack
results.description:
Sound is hiring a Staff Engineer to help shape the future of a new music economy that values artists and their music while connecting fans more closely to the music they love.

 

As Staff Engineer, you will lead technical direction for our engineering team while contributing as an individual contributor to our code base. You will architect and drive new projects, design and implement API layers, and improve our performance and reliability as we rapidly scale our product and organization. This includes our core song and artist pages for listening parties, web3 economic tools (NFTs, splits), community management tools, governance and membership tools to empower the next wave of crypto-native artists and their communities. You will be involved in product decisions and have a direct impact on the end user experience.

 

Responsibilities

  • Set the technical direction for the team and help guide engineering vision

  • Lead the architecting of important systems and anticipate strategic and scaling-related challenges

  • Design, build, and continually improve Sound's core backend infrastructure

  • Develop a robust product-focused API layer used by front-end developers and eventually external developers building on top of Sound

  • Act as a player-coach and champion code quality & developer experience

  • Improve our real-time blockchain data pipelines

  • Collaborate to improve continuous integration, deployment, logging, metrics, and visibility into service/site health

  • Develop best practices for backend application development

  • Mentor and train other engineers on the team

     

Requirements

  • 10+ years of experience in software engineering

  • Experience building and maintaining a production system at scale

  • Experience with TypeScript and GraphQL

  • Comfortable with SQL databases

  • Ability to write well-tested, performant code

  • Curiosity to understand and pick up new tools and technologies

  • Desire to continually improve code quality and development experience

     

Nice to have

  • Experience working with serverless architecture

  • Experience with message queues and caching infrastructure

  • Experience working with microservices

  • Understanding of Ethereum, Arweave, IPFS architectures

  • Experience with shipping user-facing features with modern frameworks (React, Relay, Next.js)

  • History of open source contributions

  • Degree in computer science

     

Sound's Benefits

Our vision for the future is ambitious: we want to honor the value of music by giving a million artists the opportunity to live off their music. Here are some of our benefits:

  • We offer top-of-the-line benefits, including health, mental health, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Remote-first teamwork with team and community members around the world

  • Work-from-home/remote office stipend

  • Team offsites for periodic collaborative strategy sessions in person

  • Passionate, supportive team dedicated to learning and growing together in web3

 

Sound is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity, and welcome people from a variety of backgrounds, ethnicities, cultures, perspectives, experiences, and skill sets. As part of our commitment to equality, we work to ensure a fair and consistent interview process, and continue to promote an inclusive work environment.

We believe that a diverse team composed of individuals with different perspectives, lived experiences, and identities is essential to achieving our mission and upending old models of selling and sharing art. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are accommodated in the job application and interview process, and in the performance of essential job functions.
